title: What champion should I get?
body:
I'm in need of some mid laners and so far I've only got {{champion:1}} {{champion:38}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:13}}  and {{champion:62}} if you count him. 

I have enough for anyone so long as I wait for them to be on sale and I'd prefer to use my RP on either the 4800 or 6300 ip champions because the others I can just get with ip and I'd like to stay away from the assassins like Zed, Fizz, Akali etc.. for now because I know Riot is looking at them and I don't know how they'll change.

replies.body:
Hey there SlimyDan,

I like your choice in champs there, although, some of them I wouldn't call mid laners. 
To answer your question. If you're after mid lane champs that aren't necessarily assassin type may I suggest any of the below.

Orianna, Cassiopeia, Anivia. Anivia is my personal favourite and has been since I started playing this game. Whilst all of these champs can still be assassins due to their potential burst. I think you will find them more suited to your style over "assassins like Zed, Fizz, Akali etc." .

Hope this helps.
Fog - Formerly lols now back under by old name.

{{champion:6}}  is a pretty good midlaner...


Not really, hes better top.

Swain and Brand are good mages (In my opinion) at the moment, as DFG isn't commonly built on them (Which is getting removed).

{{champion:50}}  - Really good tanky mage who deals sustained AOE damage. Everyone seems to underestimate this guys damage.
{{champion:63}}  - Really good AOE burst mage. His passive burn combined with Liandry's burn hurts like hell.

Both of these guys decimate team fights. I recommend them both if you aren't looking for assassins. However, these two do not have any inbuilt escapes, so please ward your lane :D 

{{item:2044}}

As for champs to buy, my personal favorites are talon, wukong, brand, viktor and malzahar for high burst or swain for ridiculous sustained damage. I also play mordekaiser and yasuo, but I find both are better as AD tops.

I know a lot of people play yasuo mid, but to play him flawlessly mid is highly difficult, and it is very easy to get poked down in mid. That said, he is a very strong anti-assassin mid laner (except against fizz cuz screw fizz) and counters picks such as zed, akali and katarina.

My personal advice is to learn wukong mid, since he is EXTREMELY powerful and underrated. As long as you can have a decent ap top, you can first pick him and make enemies try and counter you at top. He is also an amazing burster with great zoning, poking, escaping, roaming, ganking, tanking and disrupting potential, since he is an assassin with bruiser and tank traits, allowing him to easily switch between the roles depending on the enemies.
Actually, yasuo is a great match up against fizz. You gotta fly that kite like a pro though.

To be honest if it comes down to skills yasuo has a much higher skillcap, and can potentially outplay fizz, but you gotta remember fizz's q is targeted like yasuo's e, has longer range, is faster and hurts like hell. Compared to the speed fizz can execute his combo and e away, yasuo suddenly feels like a sluggish old man. That said, it is possible to outplay him by abusing his q's fixed range, but this is a very hard matchup in general for yasuo.

I actually played Kong mid recently and did pretty decent. I was against a Zed and due to an early surprize from Shaco I fell behind but by mid game I was able to 1v1 him so it worked out. 
Wukong does actually do alright against most of the assassins that are being picked mid but I do feel as though if he got matched up against certain mid laners then he may get his ass kicked. 
I was actually planning on getting into him mid a bit more, I even went to youtube and watched the early laning phase for maybe 10-15 games. The reason I was wanting a different mid laner was in case I get a matchup that would wreck me I want to have someone to fall back on.

I don't play Vlad mid, I just listed him as a mid laner because I think that was what his original design was for

Well, to be honest, Wukong mid doesn't have many bad matchups aside from mainly ahri and fizz. Most other matchups are skill dependant on how well you can play Wukong. He is also an amazing champ to play mind games with your opponents, and you can actually deny them cs just by standing still while also constantly putting them on edge and making them somewhat paranoid by pressing double s, which makes you seem like you used your w :3.

Of course, this only works when ahead, but your clone is also extremely useful in many situations, and is the main reason why I consider him an assassin. The stealth is useful, it counts as a champion and thus can be used to block skillshots or bait enemy ults, and the obviousness is highly useful for risky jukes.

Wukong mid has amazing poke via his e auto q combo, and then simply walk out or w out. If they decide to engage after your combo, the attack speed boost from your dash is highly useful, and the clone can be used in a duel to absorb damage and wait for cooldowns. As a potential top/jungle as well, it means he is a great duelist and the passive easily allows him to transition into a tank, bruiser, or simply give him a bit more survivability as an assassin.

As for the arguments that he lacks burst and is a sustained damage dealer, it is clearly said by someone who has not witnessed a Wukong mid and have only ever seen tank Wukong. Wukong with a trinity force has devastating burst, and while he lacks insane instant burst like a talon, he makes up for it for having great dps after his burst anyways, along with possibly one of the most powerful ultimates in the game.

Of course, there are matchups where Wukong will lose, and I do recommend that you have a few backups, such as a few mages in case of AD tops, in which case I would recommend Swain, Malzahar or Brand.

I play Lucian mid lane actually with some very rewarding results, just don't play aggressive until you build static shiv and don't roam until you get infinity edge.
Most of the time using e to avoid danger positions when "dancing" with lane opponents works while lining up your q.
Try to make use of your passive to execute minions as much as possible
w is good for proc-ing passive while doing it in the middle of the minion wave allows you to give chase if you gain the advantage.
reserve your ultimate for "sniping" enemies due to its deceptively long range or hounding down enemies who pick up the offensive on you (using e in conjunction too!) however make sure you keep an eye on your mana as your q can quickly cost more then your ultimate

Hope this helps

Tru!!. A funny game I had a while back vs a lux, you can dodge all of her stuff by using e on a minion. And those quinn roams. I think karmas really well rounded champ ATM also. When I mid if im against some %%%% like akali, zed, I use malzahar, if im against something like ori, ill use karma. If enemy is melee and AD, use quinn :^)

Gragas' nerfs were reallly hard. His AP ratios were basically cut in half. He's better as an AP Bruiser in top lane. And I'm a really big Lissandra player but she's getting nerfed in the next patch and DFG is getting removed which hurts her lots. I'd wait on buying Liss for now.

And with Assassin just make sure you cs well and you THINK ABOUT WHO YOU'RE ASSASSINATING.
Play wukong mid, never look back.

Malphite, WUkong and Vlad are usually top Champs. It seems like you enjoy going semi tank champs, so Gragas is alright. I'd recommend malzahar though. He is a bit of an assasin but not like the one's you mentioned. He might help you understand combos and help with CS, i know he helped me.

Yeah I was considering getting Liss because I like champions that have a strong teamfight ultimate, I tend to play champions like Malphite, Wukong, and Vlad for that reason but I was also thinking about getting Gragas because he seems like he's a safe pick.
The thing I worry about with assassins is that if you don't do well and can't assassinate then you're less useful than someone like Malphite who can still use his ult to his team's advantage if behind.

The good meta Mids atm are Ahri, Syndra, Lissandra, Orianna, Xerath, Kassadin, Zed, Fizz, Akali, Katarina, Yasuo, Talon and Leblanc. Take your pick. 

The mids you mentioned are more top laners now.

And apart from those Ziggs, Jayce, Kayle and Brand are still kinda ok.

If I may make a suggestion, if you're looking at climbing solo Ranked, you should be exercising teamwork, but at the same time, you can't be sure of your teammate's skill level as much as you can be of yours. So my rule of thumb is pick OP champs that can carry. (Not that I'm Challenger but ever since I figured this out, climbing became much easier) Akali, Kat, Fizz, Syndra, Ahri, LB, Yas, Talon. Generally Assassins snowball harder and looking after yourself can be much easier. (Not saying all of those champs are op btw)

I'm a mid lane main also and am looking to widen my champ pool. I have a few on my list.

I'm a great fan of assassins, but actually don't have many of the ones you'd think.

Personal favourites,

-{{champion:157}} Yasuo, I mained him for ages and still often play him. He's really viable and also fun to play with some interesting abilities which aren't exactly stock standard. He's unlikely to be nerfed in the near future IMO as Riot DID just buff his Q...
-{{champion:55}} Katarina, I used to main Katarina also and had a lot of fun with her.
-{{champion:84}} Akali, I've just bought her and find her fun to play. However she's just a liiiiitle to strong it seems and might get changed in the future.
-{{champion:45}} Veigar, He's not your normal assasin but he does have a lot of burst. He's also really cheap so you may as well pick him up.
-{{champion:7}} Leblanc, I kinda of play her more for personal enjoyment, but she is a viable pick. Destroys Teemo early so that's always nice.

You might be better with the likes of Ziggs{{champion:115}} , Ahri{{champion:103}} , Twisted Fate{{champion:4}} , Lux{{champion:99}} , Gragas{{champion:79}} , Syndra{{champion:134}}  etc. I haven't played a lot of any of most of the latter list, however you might find them more appealing as I AM more into the assassins. I'd do some research of those ones if I was you and see if you like them.

Neither of your 'mids' are mainly played mid anymore, Annie (even though she is fine at mid) has been played more support & the rest usually get played top though are ok mid besides probably wu-kong.

  You should just buy some of the cheaper mid lane champs to figure out who you like before spending lots of ip or rp. Twisted fate is the cheapest one you don't have who isn't an assasin and if you can spend 3150 there is the likes of lux, karthus, anivia and karma (who can double as a support). Veigar is not your typical assasin so you could try him aswell.
